b891538c-0897-406d-80e6-121b2d726956.description: Medical terminology is a specialized language used in medicine that allows for quick, efficient communication between healthcare practitioners while minimizing the potential for misunderstandings. In this course, the role of interprofessional education will be discussed as mode of creating the experience that “occurs when students from two or more professions learn about, from, and with each other." Without medical terminology, this communication would be moot.
b891538c-0897-406d-80e6-121b2d726956.name: Interprofessional Education in Medical Terminology

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes during the course; finally perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

008c2511-8cf1-4e30-9344-e5f7609cb936.description: Medical terminology is a specialized language used in medicine that allows for quick, efficient communication between healthcare practitioners while minimizing the potential for misunderstandings. In this course, we examine word origin and structure through the introduction of prefixes, suffixes, root words, plurals, abbreviations and symbols.
008c2511-8cf1-4e30-9344-e5f7609cb936.name: Medical Terminology Basics

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes during the course; finally perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes during the course; finally perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

93e3dc3f-cbbd-48a0-965a-661778a9657c.description: Medical terminology is a specialized language used in medicine that allows for quick, efficient communication between healthcare practitioners while minimizing the potential for misunderstandings. In this course, we examine word origin and structure through the introduction of prefixes, suffixes, root words, plurals, abbreviations and symbols specific for pharmacology.

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes during the course; finally perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

48497e83-78ca-402c-9c3b-713954ed71e6.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have completed 8 separate badges from educational modules within a series called Basic Medical Terminology. Course include but are not limited to medical terminology basics and a basic analysis of root words, suffixes, prefixes and abbreviations for the following systems: blood and lymphatic, cardiovascular and respiratory, pharmacology, digestive and endocrine, integument and musculoskeletal, nervous system and sense organs and inter-professional education.
48497e83-78ca-402c-9c3b-713954ed71e6.name: Medical Terminology Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentations, watch pre-recorded video of lectures, successfully passed proficiency testing at the end each module as well as quizzes, games during the course; finally perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

20748feb-4e5f-42fe-a610-820e20a2bbbe.description: Earners of this badge have a fundamental understanding of how to conduct an illness specific history and examination. They will display proper escalation of care as needed which may include referrals for further testing, medical care, home care or hospitalization.
20748feb-4e5f-42fe-a610-820e20a2bbbe.name: Basic Telehealth Assessment of Suspected COVID-19 Patients

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

507fd3e9-9026-4804-90fb-7469f8c42928.description: Earners of this badge will define COVID-19 symptoms and testing. Demonstration of proper hand hygiene, Don and Doff of PPE from CDC recommendations. Discuss basic prevention techniques including disinfecting high-tough surfaces, employee accountability, adequately stocking of PPE, clustering care, and increased communication in the workplace, adhering to facility protocols and transporting and discharging COVID-19 patients via CDC recommendations.
507fd3e9-9026-4804-90fb-7469f8c42928.name: Hygiene and CDC Recommendations

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

0300df23-fab0-4644-a690-9a35539f2158.description: Earners of this badge will define the guidelines, current data, practice recommendations, and patient recommendations from ACOG and WHO regarding antenatal care in both inpatient and outpatient settings for pregnant and breastfeeding women positive for COVID-19.
0300df23-fab0-4644-a690-9a35539f2158.name: Pregnancy and Breastfeeding COVID-19

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

b95cb480-2149-4bd8-8c06-bfbeeb29d01c.description: Earners of this badge will compare adaptive and innate immunity, define the inflammasome and a cytokine storm and explain how the pathogenesis of COVID19 is different than other SARS-like viruses. Research for disease prevention diet, exercise, avoidance of mucogenic foods, sleep, stress management and food choices including spices to support better immune function will be discussed focusing on use of melatonin, Vitamin D, C, E, Quercetin, Andrograpis, Artemisia to name a few.
b95cb480-2149-4bd8-8c06-bfbeeb29d01c.name: Prevention of Viral Illnesses in Alternative Medicine

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

64361c33-6c45-4bf8-a01c-5d42ac04438d.description: Earners of this badge must be able to define admission criteria and services offered in end of life scenarios as well as define when and how to refer to different agencies or organizations providing this type of counseling. Students must model therapeutic communication (both physical and verbal) to deliver better care to patients and families.
64361c33-6c45-4bf8-a01c-5d42ac04438d.name: Counseling and End-of-Life Care

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

9f8e5233-4342-46ad-a353-5e4fee4fcabc.description: Earners of this badge will identify levels of stressors / crisis that first responders may encounter; they can recognize signs and symptoms of a crisis or critical incident stress and define the differences of short and long term VS unresolved stressors. Define PTSS from critical incident stress. Discussions of stress reduction and management techniques with employment assistance programs will be mentioned as will services offered by Critical Incident Stress Management (CISM) teams.
9f8e5233-4342-46ad-a353-5e4fee4fcabc.name: Crisis Intervention and Stress Management

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

skills.name: Managing Stress In Self And Others

56fbd96b-f661-4ccb-94b2-65c0ed8919c7.description: In this badge, participants will focus on recognizing the characteristics of cognitive behavioral therapy, how to identify the steps of formal inquiry and questions designed to shift perspective.
56fbd96b-f661-4ccb-94b2-65c0ed8919c7.name: Life XT Inquiry

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates.

bde0ca39-0b8c-4428-b3c5-ccd64d9eac67.description: In this course, the principals of LIfe XT are presented for the enhancement of human performance by providing the necessary tools for increasing resilience to stress and maximizing joy, meaning, and productivity in modern life. This module will focus on meditation benefits, principles and practice. Earners will be able to distinguish between focused-attention meditation, open awareness meditation, and compassion or loving-kindness meditation.
bde0ca39-0b8c-4428-b3c5-ccd64d9eac67.name: Life XT Meditation

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates.

3576846b-409d-46b3-b6f7-b422b3f6cbea.description: Earners of this badge will define stress and stress behaviors, coping mechanisms and support systems to best assist both adults & children. Highlights will include identifying your support system, support systems available at your healthcare facility - EAP and discussion of everyday strategies and CDC recommendations for children and adults.
3576846b-409d-46b3-b6f7-b422b3f6cbea.name: Self-Care for Healthcare Workers

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

skills.name: Managing Stress In Self And Others

1b5d4c2f-2f27-4c6c-aa55-ce69a67da0c6.description: Earners of this badge can monitor patients for emergency signs, prevent spread of germs and provide symptom treatment. Discussion of home isolation, avoiding exposure, providing spaces to talk, age appropriate activities for younger people, connect to others and communication and support techniques. Connect families remotely to external support sources such as Illinois Dept. of Aging, NAMI-Illinois, State of Illinois; AARP, Red Cross, CDC, and WHO.
1b5d4c2f-2f27-4c6c-aa55-ce69a67da0c6.name: Support of COVID-19+ Family Members

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

c05a73b7-b4ef-4104-9541-813c598028ae.description: Earners of this badge discover how other countries have been treating those infected with COVID-19. From China's use of TCM and head shaving, to Singapore’s early response system or Italy’s extensive testing to both symptomatic and asymptomatic people combined with border control and differing examples of PPE, we analyze these methods effectiveness in COVID-19 prevention and spread compared to the U.S. response.
c05a73b7-b4ef-4104-9541-813c598028ae.name: Learning Strategies in COVID-19: Success from Other Countries

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch video of lecture and successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module.

c395bcc3-d60f-496f-8655-22f014f2cf2b.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have completed 9 separate badges from educational modules within a series called Nursing Readiness in the Face of COVID-19. Course include but are not limited to prevention of infection, telehealth assessment, best practices in pregnancy and breast feeding, infection identification / control and tracking used in other countries, stress management for healthcare practitioners, management strategies for COVID-19+ family members and end of life care.
c395bcc3-d60f-496f-8655-22f014f2cf2b.name: Nursing Readiness in the Face of COVID-19 Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of 9 separate PowerPoint presentation, watched videos of lectures and successfully passed all 9 proficiency tests at the end of each of the educational modules.

588ca140-36ee-44b4-b127-66250fd844b4.description: In this badge, participants will focus on defining the practice of engagement, how to identify two tools for building the habit of engagement as well as identifying three criteria for activities that build flow. Participants will be encouraged to learn better integration into both home and work. A final assessment comparing the initial well being assessment to the present one after program completion.
588ca140-36ee-44b4-b127-66250fd844b4.name: Life XT Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates.

81307dc0-4e1c-41c2-939d-f4cb42b13d44.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have complete the coursework for 3 separate badges within the Life XT Resilience Course. These modules include but are not limited to the following badges: Meditation, Inquiry and Engagement.
81307dc0-4e1c-41c2-939d-f4cb42b13d44.name: Life XT Resilience Micorcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates, completion of all 3 badges within the collection and completion of a final exam to gauge competency in topics covered and ensure knowledge acquisition.

a9d40be5-bbdf-4c41-af34-ff0a7fd5fb9c.description: The goal of this 1.6 hour credit baring badge is to increase staff competence and comfort working with TGNC clients/patients to ensure an affirming space for all. This is an interactive session that focusses on practical daily skills in reference to discussing the difference between sexual orientation and gender identity / gender expressions as well as to understand the impact of using gender appropriate language and how to develop those skills.
a9d40be5-bbdf-4c41-af34-ff0a7fd5fb9c.name: Gender Appropriate Language (GApL) Practical Skills Development

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.6 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

8e85e88c-2598-4d8b-ac8f-5f18c93ee5b2.description: The goal of this 1.7 hour credit baring badge is to provide skills and increase comfortability of providers and patient-facing staff when collecting sexual orientation and gender identity information.
8e85e88c-2598-4d8b-ac8f-5f18c93ee5b2.name: Sexual Orientation Gender Identity (SOGI) Practical Skills Development & Best Practices

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.7 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

592cc348-0130-4aed-ace3-92556e5c5010.description: The goal of this 1.3 hour credit baring badge is to educate on the foundational concepts on TGNC (transgender and gender non-conforming communities) and provide essential information about the TGNC community with emphasis on terminology, health disparities, best practices and standards of care for healthcare providers.
592cc348-0130-4aed-ace3-92556e5c5010.name: TGNC Communities 101- Foundations of Care

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.3 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

9e6b0717-a4f6-4af8-b05c-95454d5bf03d.description: The goal of this 1.7 hour credit baring badge is to instruct learners on the demographic, compounded disparities and multiple barriers to care for aging LGBT adults focusing on nurses and providers who provide direct care to said patients. Focus areas include an introduction to LGBT elders, health disparities and barriers to care, sex and sexuality in the older LGBT adult, legal and financial barriers to care, transgender elders and HIV and aging.
9e6b0717-a4f6-4af8-b05c-95454d5bf03d.name: Health Education About LGBT Elders (HEALE) - Best Practices in Primary Care

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.7 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

41063b45-e551-47cb-b434-9432b84fb50c.description: The goal of this 1.7 hour credit badge is to introduce students to critical concepts / theories that influence the conceptualization of behavioral health & well-being in LGBTQ patient populations. Concepts addressed include LGBTQ identity development, the intersection of sexual orientation & gender identity, LGBTQ minority stress, developmental trajectories of LGBTQ people & the impact of discrimination, oppression & microaggression. 1 hour of implicit bias training is included in this training.
41063b45-e551-47cb-b434-9432b84fb50c.name: LGBTQ Behavioral Health Conceptual Foundations of Care

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 3.6 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

34a5184a-3e37-4121-a533-1ed5b482211a.description: Earners of this 1.6 hour credit baring badge have studied the essential information about the LGBTQ community with basics on terminology, health disparities, best practices and standards of care for healthcare providers. These descriptions, vocabulary, language and concepts are threaded throughout this entire course and are foundational to the understanding of further information.
34a5184a-3e37-4121-a533-1ed5b482211a.name: LGBTQ Communities 101- Foundations of Care

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.6 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

1077a436-4e89-4572-bab9-898abd3a13a2.description: The goal of this 1.1 hour credit baring badge focuses on issues connected to trauma in individuals that require professionals to utilize trauma-informed care frameworks to optimize health and wellness.
1077a436-4e89-4572-bab9-898abd3a13a2.name: Trauma Informed Care for LGBTQ Communities

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.1 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

f5a84511-f4b7-4b39-8b82-de02f26d1a4e.description: The goal of this 1.3 hour credit baring badge is to instruct learners on the health issues, the underlying causes and strategies to address common issues and distinct concerns for bisexual people. Topics will align with sexual orientations and gender identities with a focus on health issues and will recommended evidence based best practices for multiple disciplines.
f5a84511-f4b7-4b39-8b82-de02f26d1a4e.name: Clinical Foundations - Health Disparities for Bisexual People

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.3 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

398ea919-0443-45e5-a1dd-76a21a977a91.description: The goal of this 2 hour credit baring badge is to instruct learners on the health issues, the underlying causes and strategies to address common issues and distinct concerns for gay men. Topics will align with sexual orientations and gender identities with a focus on health issues and will recommended evidence based best practices for multiple disciplines.
398ea919-0443-45e5-a1dd-76a21a977a91.name: Clinical Foundations - Health Disparities for Gay Men

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 2 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

f9422540-d16b-41aa-945b-4980d2a7c188.description: The goal of this 2 hour credit baring badge is to instruct learners on the health issues, the underlying causes and strategies to address common issues and distinct concerns for lesbian identified people. Topics will align with sexual orientations and gender identities with a focus on health issues and will recommended evidence based best practices for multiple disciplines.
f9422540-d16b-41aa-945b-4980d2a7c188.name: Clinical Foundations - Health Disparities for Lesbian Identified People

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 2 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

cc3adb81-1ad9-47f2-8581-c8ff0b3aeb7f.description: The goal of this 1.5 hour credit baring badge is to instruct learners on the health issues, the underlying causes and strategies to address common issues and distinct concerns for people identifying as queer. Topics will align with sexual orientations and gender identities with a focus on health issues and will recommended evidence based best practices for multiple disciplines.
cc3adb81-1ad9-47f2-8581-c8ff0b3aeb7f.name: Clinical Foundations - Health Disparities for Queer People

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.5 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

1449b74b-c03f-4941-b38b-879f4b487294.description: The goal of this 1.3 hour credit baring badge is to instruct learners on the health issues, the underlying causes and strategies to address common issues and distinct concerns for people identifying as transgender and gender non-conforming (TGNB). Topics will align with sexual orientations and gender identities with a focus on health issues and will recommended evidence based best practices for multiple disciplines.
1449b74b-c03f-4941-b38b-879f4b487294.name: Clinical Foundations - Health Disparities for TGNB People

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.3 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

806096d6-50b8-4f6e-841f-919c24abf726.description: The goal of this 3.1 hour credit baring badge is to instruct learners on best practices for a gender affirming physical exam, gender appropriate history-taking, body part inventory and sexual health history.
806096d6-50b8-4f6e-841f-919c24abf726.name: Health Assessment and Physical Examination for LGBTQ Populations

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 3.1 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

ece679b1-052f-43e3-91eb-4e03e8b7a330.description: The goal of this 1.8 hour CEU credit baring badge is to instruct learners on the basic needs, supports, and resources a patient may need if they carry an HIV diagnosis. Multiple Chronic Conditions (MCC) and long-term health issues (HIV, Hepatitis C) can cause emotional trauma that requires behavioral support, all of which will be discussed in this badge.
ece679b1-052f-43e3-91eb-4e03e8b7a330.name: HIV 101 and Chronic Illness

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.8 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

71106892-f8a8-46a8-9d86-dbdc14c56893.description: The goal of this 1.7 hour credit baring badge focusses on the unique behavioral health concerns of lesbian, gay and bisexual young children and adolescents.
71106892-f8a8-46a8-9d86-dbdc14c56893.name: LGB Children and Adolescents

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watched video of pre-recorded lecture, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 1.7 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

2e716f90-a274-4533-8d03-ef8f428564ce.description: This penultimate badge is the culmination of 27 hours of asynchronous online and 3 hours of synchronous online CEU education from the accumulation of 15 separate badges. Completed course objective include defining essential terminology, identifying health disparities and standards of care for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender patients regardless of age. Providers can effectively gather SOGI data, provide gender affirming examinations in a trauma informed model and provide chronic disease care.
2e716f90-a274-4533-8d03-ef8f428564ce.name: Microcredential - Providing Affirmative Care fir LGBTQ+ Patients

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentations, watched videos of pre-recorded lectures, successfully passed proficiency tests at the end of each of the 15 educational modules and participation in 3 synchronous Grand Rounds sessions.

CEU hours offered for completion: 30 hours of higher education CEU, nursing CEU and Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport (Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Mississippi, Montana, Nebraska, New Jersey, Ohio, Rhode Island, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, Washington DC, and Wyoming).

53afd613-6926-407d-a1ce-db68a6499f26.description: In this course, the role of interprofessional education will be discussed as the mode of creating the experience that “occurs when students from two or more professions learn about, from, and with each other." The 4 competency domains will be introduced: values and ethics, roles and responsibilities, communication, teams and teamwork as well as introduce Team STEPPS (Strategies and Tools to Enhance Performance and Patient Safety).
53afd613-6926-407d-a1ce-db68a6499f26.name: Introduction to Interprofessional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation and voice over PowerPoint lectures, watch pre-recorded videos, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes and self assessments during the course

a93f0eae-94f9-452e-92b0-b89ea3df6cae.description: In this course, the earner will be expected to undergo a perioperative simulation in a state-of-the art simulated environment. Earners will have the chance to scrub, glove, gown and practice aseptic technique in an operating room environment. Earners will be required to complete a ticket to entry and will learn about, from, and with other healthcare professionals in the simulated scenario.
a93f0eae-94f9-452e-92b0-b89ea3df6cae.name: Simulation in Interprofessional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation and voice over PowerPoint lectures, watch pre-recorded videos, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes and self assessments during the course

30d3b288-fa69-4623-ac31-46982c4fcdbf.description: In this course, the role of values and ethics within interprofessional education will be discussed by review case studies and discussions involving ethical dilemmas. Earners will explore and clarify values, writes personal statements on values and ethics, review TED Talks on being present and learn the practical skill of cultural engagement, cultural humility and cultural competence.
30d3b288-fa69-4623-ac31-46982c4fcdbf.name: Values and Ethics in Interprofessional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation and voice over PowerPoint lectures, watch pre-recorded videos, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes and self assessments during the course

c6d5ccce-3c3f-4818-ae84-9f33c0cd54f1.description: In this course, the role of communication within interprofessional education will be discussed by exploring interpersonal and communication skills. Earners will be expected to learn behaviors for success, improve difficult conversations and learn the importance of customer service as well as discuss generational management.
c6d5ccce-3c3f-4818-ae84-9f33c0cd54f1.name: Communication in Interprofessional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation and voice over PowerPoint lectures, watch pre-recorded videos, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes and self assessments during the course

skills.name: Adapt And Adopt Appropriate Communication Style To Audience

e7d47606-7571-48a9-a459-4c40896172f4.description: In this course, earners will discuss the assumptions of healthcare workers’ roles and responsibilities. They will clarify their role by uploading a personal video discussing their roles as well as how to forge independent relationships with other professionals via discussion boards. Earners will learn how other professionals complement their role.
e7d47606-7571-48a9-a459-4c40896172f4.name: Roles and Responsibilities in Interprofessional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation and voice over PowerPoint lectures, watch pre-recorded videos, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes and self assessments during the course

0815200b-c0a6-447d-acab-3f787a4d4863.description: This penultimate badge displays that earners have completed 6 badges accumulating into the Perioperative IPE Microcredential. The badges and information include but are not limited to Introduction to IPE, Roles and Responsibilities, Values and Ethics, Teams and Teamwork, Communication and Simulation within the perioperative setting.
0815200b-c0a6-447d-acab-3f787a4d4863.name: Perioperative Interprofessional Education Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation and voice over PowerPoint lectures, watch pre-recorded videos, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes and self assessments during the course

a9b37f99-ce93-4892-b047-f7643c5dfbd7.description: In this course, the role of teams and teamwork within interprofessional education will be discussed by defining what is a teams. Earners will explore emotional intelligence, participate in a team project, listen to podcasts and participate in discussions on trust as well as engage in a CQI overview . Finally they will provide personal reflections on team experiences.
a9b37f99-ce93-4892-b047-f7643c5dfbd7.name: Teams & Teamwork in Interprofessional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation and voice over PowerPoint lectures, watch pre-recorded videos, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as quizzes and self assessments during the course

0d65454f-be97-4976-9206-cf8fabb95c8c.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have completed 102 hour of education - 80 hours live in person hands on training and 22 hours of asynchronous online distance learning for TCM and acupuncture theory.
0d65454f-be97-4976-9206-cf8fabb95c8c.name: Basic Acupuncture 100 Hour Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentations, watch pre-recorded video of lectures, successfully passed proficiency testing at the end of the online modules, successful completion of Clean Needle Technique written and practical examinations, participated in all class hours of live course instruction culminating in successful completion of both a compressive written final examination and practical examination.

e87e50b7-ca64-4ad8-bd00-c1e417688911.description: In this course, badge earners begin building on topics covered in the first Life XT microcredential on Resilience. In this module, the focus lies being present and overcoming distraction. Earners will be able to decreased mind wandering and enhance engagement with increased productivity.
e87e50b7-ca64-4ad8-bd00-c1e417688911.name: Life XT Presence

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates.

2fd988b8-64ef-4a62-aaa1-96375ec549dc.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed uses and safety standards for cupping (ba gua), moxibustion (direct and indirect), auriculotherapy, electroacupuncture, and musculoskeletal needling, with introductory trigger point dry needling. Extensive supervised laboratory practicum provides attendees ample time to practice all of the listed techniques.
2fd988b8-64ef-4a62-aaa1-96375ec549dc.name: Basic Acupuncture Auriculotherapy, Adjunctive Therapy & MSK

badge_template_activities.title: Review of 4 separate PowerPoint presentations, watched videos of lectures, participated in live course instruction for needle insertion and safety, successfully passed 4 proficiency tests at the end of each educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 26 total hours divided as 20 hours of live education and 6 of online distance learning of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

2a6bb34f-77f0-4576-b534-3842907889d1.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed uses and safety standards for gua sha, as well as coupled extensive TCM and acupuncture research with discussion of point theory and combinations. Extensive written and practical examinations complete this course.
2a6bb34f-77f0-4576-b534-3842907889d1.name: Basic Acupuncture Comprehensive Theory Research & Review

badge_template_activities.title: Review of 3 separate PowerPoint presentations, watched videos of lectures, participated in live course instruction for needle insertion and safety, successfully passed 2 proficiency tests at the end of each educational module and participated in both a written and a practical examination.
CEU hours offered for completion: 14 total hours divided as 10 hours of live education and 4 of online distance learning of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

2daa194c-2bce-4d91-ae88-fe41ef83f3f6.description: Earners of this badge have reviewed and successfully completed the guidelines and standards for clean safe clinical practice of acupuncture combined (written and practical) with TCM philosophy including basic Five Element Theory, Yin/Yang, Qi, Shen and Ko Cycles, Horary Cycle. Introduction of the 5 patterns of health and disease based on Dr. Jon Sunderladge’s work. Discussion of meridian pathways, location of their points and clinical applications with extensive supervised laboratory practicum.
2daa194c-2bce-4d91-ae88-fe41ef83f3f6.name: Basic Acupuncture Theory & Meridians I

badge_template_activities.title: Review of 3 separate PowerPoint presentations, watched videos of lectures, participated in live course instruction for needle insertion and safety, successfully passed 2 proficiency tests at the end of each educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 31 total hours divided as 25 hours of live education and 6 of online distance learning of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

50f97ceb-6682-44bb-aebb-b064e426e050.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed TCM tongue diagnosis, 8 principals of disease including external, internal, and miscellaneous causes of disease; further discussion on point theory including antique points, command points, back Shu, front mu, luo connecting points and ghost points. The theory and usage of the Eight Extraordinary Meridians, including master / couple theory. Continued practice of the meridians emphasizing specific points for the treatment of internal disorders.
50f97ceb-6682-44bb-aebb-b064e426e050.name: Basic Acupuncture Theory & Meridians II with Internal Disorders

badge_template_activities.title: Review of 4 separate PowerPoint presentations, watched videos of lectures, participated in live course instruction for needle insertion and safety, successfully passed 3 proficiency tests at the end of each educational module.
CEU hours offered for completion: 31 total hours divided as 25 hours of live education and 6 of online distance learning of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

1b6bb575-20a1-4728-8e62-081fbdde1951.description: In this course, badge earners will use principals built upon within the Life XT framework for building empathy within themselves and for others, thus leading to decreased irritation, increased responsiveness and enhanced collaboration.
1b6bb575-20a1-4728-8e62-081fbdde1951.name: Life XT Compassion

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates.

99083750-c566-4d0e-bfdf-67568134c746.description: In this course, badge earners will use principals built upon within the Life XT framework to cultivate optimism thus achieving the goals of decreased stress which in turn will provide both enhanced physical health and better sleep.
99083750-c566-4d0e-bfdf-67568134c746.name: Life XT Gratitude

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates.

aea22e7f-a239-4b61-8544-fcfd63812b36.description: In this module, an open discussion about dietary acculturation is is covered. Topics revolving around cultural, ethnic, and religious needs and beliefs ate touched upon as well as and how religious or ethnic group adopts a dominant culture’s behaviors, beliefs, and values in relationship to food. Workshop and small group discussion on how to adapt dietary counseling in these instances is performed.
aea22e7f-a239-4b61-8544-fcfd63812b36.name: Cultural Eating

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

b20fb1bd-4164-45d0-825e-1285971ba32f.description: In this module, food storage, storage temperatures, cooking temperatures and how to identify dates on packing labels will be discussed. Signs, symptoms and common treatment of various forms of food borne illnesses will be considered. Signs of dehydration as well as the difference of immune response / allergies are defined highlighting the differentiation of allergy VS intolerance VS sensitivity. Lists of foods / medications for interactions are also provided in this section.
b20fb1bd-4164-45d0-825e-1285971ba32f.name: Food Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

da1a46a2-4870-4016-8569-cd125d768a80.description: In this module, a review of factors for inadequate nutrition within USDA guidelines for nutrient dense diet including servings, sources, and alcohol recommendations will be discussed. Students will review choosemyplate.gov website for food and exercise recommendations with budget smart shopping tips and a review of food labels. The differences of an eating plans VS diets will be highlighted and the different needs of various eating methodologies: pros, cons deficiencies and therapeutic uses.
da1a46a2-4870-4016-8569-cd125d768a80.name: Healthy Eating

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

35469e4b-a088-4ca4-874c-569161b4181e.description: In this module, the major macronutrients of protein, fat and carbohydrates will be covered as well sources and how to balance them for health and disease prevention. Dietary reference intakes will be discussed along with, BMI, BMR and caloric need. A review of the digestion and assimilation process will be conducted to best understand pathologies discussed in other badges.
35469e4b-a088-4ca4-874c-569161b4181e.name: Macronutrients

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

0e81a3d7-fb68-477b-8d92-bcffe2aeb746.description: In this module food and educational planning incorporating familial nutritional habits into care plans will be covered. How to identify and refer patient that need specialty nutritional support will be paramount. Practical practice of taking a diet history coupled with teaching patients how to weight / eyeball food portions, calculating BMI, ideal weight, difference of lean and fat mass, somatotyping and practical measurement of height and weight.
0e81a3d7-fb68-477b-8d92-bcffe2aeb746.name: Nutritional Assessment

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

a17748d8-50ee-496d-abc8-116d57daa2f3.description: In this module, instructions are given on screening and referrals for eating disorders, coupled with dietary needs for pregnancy, lactation, infancy, childhood, adolescence, adulthood and geriatric populations. Discussion of vitamin needs, common pitfalls, choking hazards, dysphagia diet, general balanced diet including exercise recommendations and fluid intake are covered with highlighting the difference / needs for clear liquid diet, full liquid diet, pureed and soft diet.
a17748d8-50ee-496d-abc8-116d57daa2f3.name: Nutritional Needs and Modified Diets

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

ca07c87f-42cc-4bd7-8bde-c6d53c2aa28c.description: In this module we define enteral VS parenteral nutrition (PN), when and why to use enteral VS parenteral nutrition and different types of tubing and choosing appropriate formulas. Feeding schedules, preparation methods and calculation of residuals are covered with ongoing care for EN, interventions and weening and complications including refeeding syndrome / dumping syndrome. For PN, patients’ preparation and care are discussed with complications and medical actions needed for PN monitoring.
ca07c87f-42cc-4bd7-8bde-c6d53c2aa28c.name: Enteral and Total Parenteral Nutrition

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

41838848-1a61-4772-a7db-07696733bd66.description: In this module, we will asses poor dentition, socioeconomic status, cognitive disorders, altered sensory perception, swallowing impairment and mechanical jaw dysfunction as well as medical conditions that can change nutritional needs. Significant lab findings, signs and symptoms common within the conditions will be included as well dietary needs. From GI to renal disorders inclusive of complexion conditions such as diabetes, cancer, HIV/AIDS and immunocompromised patients will be covered.
41838848-1a61-4772-a7db-07696733bd66.name: Specialty Diets for Health Conditions

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

02592acc-12b9-4bd9-ad43-70d2d17b950d.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed 8 hours of combined education (4 asynchronous and 4 live hands on) enabling them to define both the "core" VS pelvic floor dysfunction (PFD) and common conditions such as but not limited to pelvic organ prolapse, pelvic pain with a focus for the full body evaluation and subsequent application of external pelvic floor rehabilitation techniques to assist patients. A strong focus on anatomy and function will be reviewed online before the practical.
02592acc-12b9-4bd9-ad43-70d2d17b950d.name: Evaluation & Rehabilitation of Pelvic Floor Dysfunction

badge_template_activities.title: Review of a PowerPoint presentation, watched videos of lectures, successfully passed a proficiency test at the end of the educational module, participated in live course instruction on techniques, safety and application.
CEU hours offered for completion: 8 total hours divided as 4 hours of live education and 4 of online distance learning of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport.

d8a81d38-b48b-41aa-bc26-1d2e04bc6a13.description: In this multipart module both the fat and water soluble vitamins as well as the 20 amino acids, and trace minerals will be covered. Highlight for each nutrient will include signs, symptom and medical conditions of excess and deficiency, RDA (if available) and food sources of these substances. Research will be presented with each vitamin, mineral and amino acid on uses for prevention and treatment.
d8a81d38-b48b-41aa-bc26-1d2e04bc6a13.name: Micronutrients: Amino Acids and Water, Fat and Water Soluble Nutrients, Mineral and Trace Minerals

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the module and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

f6d986c0-cc9f-4b5b-9dca-9bae6ac67525.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have completed 9 separate badges from educational modules within a series called Beyond the Basics: Nutrition for the Healthcare Practitioner. Course include but are not limited to macro- and micronutrients, EN and TPN, cultural eating, food safety, nutritional assessment, nutritional needs in the life cycle and within modified diets and finally specialty diets for healthcare needs and conditions.
f6d986c0-cc9f-4b5b-9dca-9bae6ac67525.name: Beyond the Basics: Nutrition for the Healthcare Practitioner Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentations, watch pre-recorded video of lectures, successfully passed proficiency testing at the end of the modules and perform a self assessment ensuring knowledge acquisition.

70da892b-8d21-448d-9449-9445de425c82.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have completed 3 separate badges from educational modules within a series called the Life XT Resilience course. Modules completed will include but are not limited to the following: Presence, Compassion and Gratitude.
70da892b-8d21-448d-9449-9445de425c82.name: Life XT Emotional Intelligence Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of Life XT presentations, view pre-recorded videos, practice audio presentations and have discussions with coaches and course mates, completion of all 3 badges within the collection and completion of a final exam to gauge competency in topics covered and ensure knowledge acquisition.

f694ed8d-bb8a-477a-a206-b286e9245687.description: This program provides learners with a wide range of patient care, administrative, and medically oriented skills and knowledge. The program has the learners spending three days per week in the classroom/simulation lab, and two days per week practicing and demonstrating skills as externs while working and shadowing healthcare professionals. The six-month, full-time program has five modules, designed to prepare learners for certification as Registered Medical Assistants.
f694ed8d-bb8a-477a-a206-b286e9245687.name: Medical Assistant Career Accelerator Program

badge_template_activities.title: Office operations to include: greeting patients and visitors; reviewing and submitting charges for patient procedures and services; and providing general office and clerical support. • Medical responsibilities to include: assisting with the examination and treatment of patients under the direction of a physician; interviewing patients, measuring vital signs, and recording information on patients’ charts; and preparing treatment rooms for examination of patients.

3abbf9e7-d0d7-4de2-ab4b-2c7f20c59b11.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have completed 6 separate modules - 4 asynchronous hour long educational modules and 2 synchronous hour long Grand Round discussion sections. Course include but are not limited to Global Response to COVID-19, Primary, Secondary and Tertiary Care, Supportive Treatment Modalities and Barriers / Interventions to Change Perceptions of COVID-19 in Vulnerable Communities.
3abbf9e7-d0d7-4de2-ab4b-2c7f20c59b11.name: COVID-19 Within the Healthcare Landscape Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: Review of 4 separate PowerPoint presentations, watched videos of lectures, successfully passed all 4 proficiency tests at the end of each of the educational modules and participated in 2 discussion groups for topics surrounding these lectures.
CEU hours offered for completion: 6 Hours of Nursing CEU

bb57ead0-5544-49a7-b2bd-c0202c98ee24.description: Earners of this penultimate badge have completed 4 separate modules of asynchronous hour long education. Course include but are not limited to Global Response to COVID-19, Primary, Secondary and Tertiary Care, Supportive Treatment Modalities and Barriers / Interventions to Change Perceptions of COVID-19 in Vulnerable Communities.
bb57ead0-5544-49a7-b2bd-c0202c98ee24.name: COVID-19 Within the Healthcare Landscape Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Review of 4 separate PowerPoint presentations, watched videos of lectures, successfully passed all 4 proficiency tests at the end of each of the educational modules.
CEU hours offered for completion: 4 Hours of Nursing CEU

5e7d6041-d6be-4b30-81b3-aadab4539ed9.description: This badge is designed to give healthcare practitioners, labor assistants and doulas an expansive list to help with pain management during later pregnancy and delivery for a successful birth for both mother and baby. The practitioner will be able to define different types of pain, the neurological signaling mechanisms involved in pain interpretation and pain gaiting, history of acupressure as well as successful application of both TENS and Acupressure for effective pain relief.
5e7d6041-d6be-4b30-81b3-aadab4539ed9.name: TENS & Acupressure for Labor and Delivery

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of each module as well as questions during the course and pass a final exam at the end of the course

CEU hours offered for completion: 4 total hours of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport; Nursing CEU thought Oak Point University; signatures from instructors available for Doula CEU as needed.

6c07017b-3c5f-447d-a829-3ce4652b23dd.description: This badge is designed to give healthcare practitioners an expansive list to help with pain management of general musculoskeletal pain In lieu of the Opioid epidemic. The practitioner will be able to define different types of pain, the neurological signaling mechanisms involved in pain interpretation and pain gaiting, history of acupressure as well as successful application of both TENS and Acupressure for effective pain relief.
6c07017b-3c5f-447d-a829-3ce4652b23dd.name: TENS & Acupressure for Musculoskeletal Pain

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of each module as well as questions during the course and pass a final exam at the end of the course

CEU hours offered for completion: 4 total hours of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport; Nursing CEU thought Oak Point University; signatures from instructors available for Doula CEU as needed.

9f46cb53-bd79-40ff-a4bd-528a913b84d0.description: This badge is designed to give healthcare practitioners foundational knowledge about the history of the hemp, the manufacturing and uses of CBD and THC from cannabis as well as information on the plant science, processing, pharmacokinetics and a discussion of the endocannabinoid system.
9f46cb53-bd79-40ff-a4bd-528a913b84d0.name: Understanding Hemp: CBD VS THC

badge_template_activities.title: Review of PowerPoint presentation, watch pre-recorded video of lecture, successfully pass proficiency testing at the end of the course as well as questions during the course as well as a final exam at the end of the course
CEU hours offered for completion: 2 total hours of Chiropractic CEU through the University of Bridgeport; Nursing CEU thought Oak Point University
